How to Take Care of Yourself

We stole a bunch of these from Jennifer Walter.

Get offline and go outside.
See people IRL. You need human contact.

Limit what you’re going to track.
Pick just a few issues and focus on those. You can’t follow everything, and that’s OK. Allow yourself to rely on others who are tracking different things.

Limit how much news you consume.
Enforce times when you’re not thinking of current events or checking the news. If you catch yourself thinking of all the bad things happening while on a mental break, tell your brain to stop. This gets easier the more you practice.

Let yourself respond slowly to some events.
Sometimes you need space to think and internalize things. Don’t let them freak you out with new awful news every 10 minutes.

IT’S OK TO BE HAPPY AND ENJOY YOURSELF SOMETIMES. REALLY. Making yourself a martyr to the cause doesn’t help anyone. There are plenty of things to enjoy even when the whole world is going down the drain. Each sunset is crazy beautiful.

What makes somebody else feel better doesn’t have to make you feel better. Everybody needs to figure out ways that help them take care of themselves.

Check in on your friends and family and see how they’re doing. We all need to be reminded someone else is looking out for us.
